intro: Conostylis aurea var. longiscapa, commonly known as the long-stemmed golden conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
